sentences.english: The judge found him guilty of unpardonable evil.
sentences.chinese: 法官认定他的罪行十恶不赦。

sentences.english: We are much too apt to look at schism in our church as an unmitigated evil.
sentences.chinese: 我们太容易把自己教会中的分立看成是十恶不赦的。

sentences.english: Fabricating data is a heinous scientific sin.
sentences.chinese: 捏造数据是十恶不赦的科学之罪。

sentences.english: There is no act more wretched than stealing, Amir, ?Baba said.
sentences.chinese: 没有比盗窃更十恶不赦的事情了，阿米尔。

sentences.english: There is no act more wretched than stealing.
sentences.chinese: 没有比盗窃更十恶不赦的事情了。

sentences.english: “Nothing is totally good or totally bad, ” Wu says.
sentences.chinese: “没有任何事物是十全十美或者十恶不赦的，”吴说。

sentences.english: There is no more heinous than stealing things, and Amir.
sentences.chinese: 没有比盗窃更十恶不赦的事情了，阿米尔。

sentences.english: I wonder how this wicked kind of people could enter the revolutionary rank?
sentences.chinese: 我怀疑有多少这种十恶不赦样的人可以进入革命队伍？

sentences.english: Time, heinous things, of course, I am all the looting.
sentences.chinese: 时间，十恶不赦的东西，理所当然地掠夺我的一切。

definition: lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
to offend Heaven and reason (idiom); bloody atrocities that cry to heaven/outrageous acts
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
disgraceful (of behavior that is unfilial, rebellious or otherwise in grave breach of the norms of society)
human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
